title: 2017 Roller Hockey Intercontinental Cup
text:
The 2017 Roller Hockey Intercontinental Cup was the 16th edition of the <a href="Roller%20hockey%20%28quad%29">roller hockey</a> tournament known as the <a href="Roller%20Hockey%20Intercontinental%20Cup">Intercontinental Cup</a>, endorsed by World Skate. It was held in the <a href="Pavell%C3%B3%20Ol%C3%ADmpic%20de%20Reus">Pavelló Olímpic</a> in <a href="Reus">Reus</a>, Spain. <a href="S.L.%20Benfica%20%28roller%20hockey%29">Benfica</a> won the competition by beating <a href="Reus%20Deportiu">Reus</a> in the final (5–3). It was their second triumph in the Intercontinental Cup.
The tournament was a knockout competition in a final four format; four teams entered, with the host selected after the teams became known. Entered the tournament the <a href="CERH%20European%20League">European League</a> winners from the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20CERH%20European%20League">2015–16</a> and <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20CERH%20European%20League">2016–17</a> seasons and the <a href="Roller%20Hockey%20South%20American%20Club%20Championship">South American Club Championship/Pan-American Club Championship</a> winners from the <a href="2016%20South%20American%20Roller%20Hockey%20Club%20Championship">2016</a> and <a href="2017%20Pan-American%20Roller%20Hockey%20Club%20Championship">2017</a> seasons.
Matches.
In all matches, <a href="Overtime%20%28sports%29">extra time</a> and a <a href="penalty%20shootout">penalty shootout</a> were used to decide the winner if necessary.
"All times are local, <a href="Central%20European%20Time">CET</a> ()."
Statistics.
Goalscorers.
With four goals, Raül Marín and Jordi Adroher were the top scorers in the tournament. In total, there were 31 goals scored by 17 different players in 3 games, for an average of 10.33 goals per game.
